tc_example3.c File Reference

Detailed Description

Timer/Counter example 3.

This example will start a timer/counter and generate a "tick" interrupt each milli-second.

  • Compiler: IAR EWAVR32 and GNU GCC for AVR32
  • Supported devices: All AVR32 devices with a TC module can be used.
  • AppNote:

Author:
Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com
Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/

Definition in file tc_example3.c.

#include <avr32/io.h>
#include "intc.h"
#include "compiler.h"
#include "board.h"
#include "pm.h"
#include "gpio.h"
#include "tc.h"
#include "usart.h"

00152   // Options for waveform genration.
00153   static const tc_waveform_opt_t WAVEFORM_OPT =
00154   {
00155     .channel  = TC_CHANNEL,                        // Channel selection.
00156 
00157     .bswtrg   = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // Software trigger effect on TIOB.
00158     .beevt    = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // External event effect on TIOB.
00159     .bcpc     = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // RC compare effect on TIOB.
00160     .bcpb     = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // RB compare effect on TIOB.
00161 
00162     .aswtrg   = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // Software trigger effect on TIOA.
00163     .aeevt    = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // External event effect on TIOA.
00164     .acpc     = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // RC compare effect on TIOA: toggle.
00165     .acpa     = TC_EVT_EFFECT_NOOP,                // RA compare effect on TIOA: toggle (other possibilities are none, set and clear).
00166 
00167     .wavsel   = TC_WAVEFORM_SEL_UP_MODE_RC_TRIGGER,// Waveform selection: Up mode with automatic trigger(reset) on RC compare.
00168     .enetrg   = FALSE,                             // External event trigger enable.
00169     .eevt     = 0,                                 // External event selection.
00170     .eevtedg  = TC_SEL_NO_EDGE,                    // External event edge selection.
00171     .cpcdis   = FALSE,                             // Counter disable when RC compare.
00172     .cpcstop  = FALSE,                             // Counter clock stopped with RC compare.
00173 
00174     .burst    = FALSE,                             // Burst signal selection.
00175     .clki     = FALSE,                             // Clock inversion.
00176     .tcclks   = TC_CLOCK_SOURCE_TC2                // Internal source clock 2 - connected to PBA/4
00177   };
00178 
00179   static const tc_interrupt_t TC_INTERRUPT =
00180   {
00181     .etrgs = 0,
00182     .ldrbs = 0,
00183     .ldras = 0,
00184     .cpcs  = 1,
00185     .cpbs  = 0,
00186     .cpas  = 0,
00187     .lovrs = 0,
00188     .covfs = 0
00189   };
00190 
00191   // Switch main clock to external oscillator 0 (crystal) : 12MHz
00192   pm_switch_to_osc0(&AVR32_PM, FOSC0, OSC0_STARTUP);
00193 
00194   static const gpio_map_t USART_GPIO_MAP =
00195   {
00196     {AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_PIN, AVR32_USART1_RXD_0_FUNCTION},
00197     {AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_PIN, AVR32_USART1_TXD_0_FUNCTION}
00198   };
00199 
00200   // USART options.
00201   static const usart_options_t USART_OPTIONS =
00202   {
00203     .baudrate     = 57600,
00204     .charlength   = 8,
00205     .paritytype   = USART_NO_PARITY,
00206     .stopbits     = USART_1_STOPBIT,
00207     .channelmode  = 0
00208   };
00209 
00210   // Assign GPIO pins to USART1.
00211   gpio_enable_module(USART_GPIO_MAP, sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP) / sizeof(USART_GPIO_MAP[0]));
00212 
00213   // Initialize USART in RS232 mode at 12MHz.
00214   usart_init_rs232(&AVR32_USART1, &USART_OPTIONS, FPBA);
00215 
00216   // Clear a VT100 terminal screen
00217   usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, "\x1B[2J");
00218   // Welcome sentence
00219   usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, "ATMEL\r\n");
00220   usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, "AVR32 UC3 - TC example\r\n");
00221 
00222   Disable_global_interrupt();
00223 
00224   // The INTC driver has to be used only for GNU GCC for AVR32.
00225 #if __GNUC__
00226   // Initialize interrupt vectors.
00227   INTC_init_interrupts();
00228 
00229   // Register the RTC interrupt handler to the interrupt controller.
00230   INTC_register_interrupt(&tc_irq, AVR32_TC_IRQ0, INT0);
00231 #endif
00232 
00233   Enable_global_interrupt();
00234 
00235   // Initialize the timer/counter.
00236   tc_init_waveform(tc, &WAVEFORM_OPT);         // Initialize the timer/counter waveform.
00237 
00238   // Set the compare triggers.
00239   // Remember TC counter is 16-bits, so counting second is not possible.
00240   // We configure it to count ms.
00241   // We want: (1/(FPBA/4)) * RC = 1000 Hz => RC = (FPBA/4) / 1000 = 3000 to get an interrupt every 1ms
00242   tc_write_rc(tc, TC_CHANNEL, (FPBA/4)/1000);  // Set RC value.
00243 
00244   tc_configure_interrupts(tc, TC_CHANNEL, &TC_INTERRUPT);
00245 
00246   // Start the timer/counter.
00247   tc_start(tc, TC_CHANNEL);                    // And start the timer/counter.
00248 
00249   while(1)
00250   {
00251     // Update the display on USART every second.
00252     if ((print_sec) && (!(tc_tick%1000)))
00253     {
00254       // Set cursor to the position (1; 5)
00255       usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, "\x1B[5;1H");
00256       ptemp = print_i(temp, tc_tick);
00257       usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, "Timer: ");
00258       usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, ptemp);
00259       usart_write_line(&AVR32_USART1, " ms");
00260       print_sec = 0;
00261     }
00262   }
00263 }
